It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features linear, succulent leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dunes. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
